snippet: Many American companies won’t divulge the tax bills they would face by bringing home their overseas earnings. It’s a figure that investors could benefit from knowing.
abstract: Gretchen Morgenson Fair Game column; most American companies will not disclose the tax bills they would face by bringing home their overseas earnings, even though inquiring shareholders want to know and could benefit from knowing; nation's top 1,000 corporations reported $2.1 trillion in earnings in their foreign operations in 2013, almost 100 percent increase since 2008.
lead_paragraph: Many American companies won’t divulge the tax bills they would face by bringing home their overseas earnings. It’s a figure that investors could benefit from knowing.

headline.main: When Taxes and Profits Are Oceans Apart
